##In Huanggang, the responsibilities of a father are rarely read

WECHAT dandureading

Function introduction single reading is a brand publication of one-way space, which unites a new generation of writers and readers. Its content is mainly fiction, poetry, cultural criticism, ideological essays, non-fiction reports and works of art, respect quiet, deep, elegant reading, respect sober, unique, dynamic voice, committed to become a source of ideas for young people around the world.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
Does growing up make us braver or more timid? The writer Tōko's answer is closer to the latter. In this COVID-19 epidemic, a distant son in Huanggang, Hubei Province, not only has to take care of himself, but also has to assume the responsibility of a husband and a father. With local roads closed, even buying a can of formula for a child has become prohibitively difficult. News and rumors from all over the place made the young father even more nervous. But at this point, it's hard to know how many more parents are going to have to tell the same story.

Epidemic diary

By Yuko

A light rain falls on the second day of the Lunar New Year on January 26,2020

Although I saw the news that the county bus station was closed the day before yesterday (23rd) , I still didn't feel trapped, probably because I spent most of last year at home writing and translating, in a state of self-isolation, and I don't have to go to work after New Year's. Yesterday (the 25th) I heard from my cousin that the villagers in their village had already closed the road spontaneously. I also heard that many villages are organizing road closures. In Our village's wechat group, several people are also asking why we haven't closed the road yet, others said that the road into the county was locked up as well -- until then I was nervous because my wife and I had only planned to stay until the third day of the Lunar New Year when we returned to the village from the county seat, the shops in town were not open, so my wife and I decided to head back to the county a day early. I called the neighbor's brother's van. He's been a cab driver in town for the last two years, and he drove home early this morning because there was no one in town. He hurriedly packed up his things and got on the bus. Big Brother said he didn't know if the road to the county town was closed or not, because he didn't go to the county town yesterday. Instead, he ran eight hundred miles to send a man from a neighboring village to Anqing to pay New Year's greetings, earning two thousand yuan, he said there were cars on the way there, people taking their temperature on the highway, there were almost no cars on the way back, and the men disappeared without a trace.

On the provincial road into the county, from time to time can see the car from the county, we concluded that the road closure is only rumors, fast into the county seat but saw a line of cars parked in front of the car behind the barrier. As we got closer, we saw a car turn back, another car drive past the open barricade, with the paramedics taking the temperature, and we figured if it was normal, we'd let it go. I was actually nervous because I had gotten up the other night with a slight cold trying to make Darling's formula, and this morning I woke up with a sore throat. I suspected I was running a low grade fever, but what if I got quarantined. In his autobiographical novel the cold, Bernhard, Count of Anhalt writes that he was suspected of having tuberculosis because of the shadow in his lungs, and was sent to a hospital specializing in tuberculosis, where he had to learn to cough as hard as any other patient, to produce a sputum sample for testing, and eventually he managed to "evolve" into a competent patient. I felt like if I was quarantined, it would be my fate, to hear that all the suspected patients in our county were concentrated in hospital x, which felt to be the worst facility in our county, where very few people went to see a doctor. I asked my wife not to take it back. My brother also said that we could have relatives from the county drive it to the roadblock. We took a car to pick it up. My Wife said we had to go back because darling didn't have any clean clothes to change into. When one of the officers came up and made a sign for us to turn back, she rolled down the window and asked him loudly why there was a car in front of us. The man replied, that's the bureau car, it's for county business. His wife pleaded that our baby has no milk powder to eat, must go back to the county, can be flexible, the other side shook his head, told us to move the car away. I asked big brother if there is a path into the county, he said he used to take a path, but do not remember clearly, and there must have been closed road, at his wife's insistence, he decided to try.

We went around to a nearby village. At the entrance of one village, we were almost hit by a car with Henan license plates that was reversing. Big Brother stopped the car and scolded the driver, on the way, we met an acquaintance sitting in the passenger seat, the village party secretary of the next village. We assumed that the road ahead must be open, and that the secretary must have come down from the county seat, drove all the way to the county tenement. It's kind of like running away. When I got home, I found that my wallet had been left in my hometown. My wife was very angry and blamed me for losing my ID card. I said that I wouldn't need it these days. She said that it was a special time. What if you went to the supermarket to buy something and had to check your ID card, but just yesterday, she told me to brush my phone less and not worry too much.

Fear travels fast. A few days ago, I urged my parents not to go out to pay new year's calls. Later, my relatives offered to stay put this year. According to the rural custom, on the first day of the New Year, I would go to every household in the village to pay new year's calls and make a fortune. On the 30th day of the Lunar New Year, I told my father that I would not go out tomorrow to pay New Year's greetings. He was a little angry and said I was making a mountain out of a molehill, so I was worried that many people would come to my house on the first day of the New Year (most of our village's laborers were working in Wuhan, and they all came back from Wuhan a few days ago) . I did not expect that only two people would come to my house. Both of them were widowers, no relatives are expected to tell them about the epidemic... in retrospect, the turning point took place on the day (23rd) when the city of Wuhan was sealed off, and there has obviously been an atmosphere of panic since then, various kinds of "horror" videos have started to spread on the Internet, with medical personnel crying, patients falling in the hospital's Toll Hall, and medical personnel carrying out bodies from the community, one wuhan-speaking nurse's voice was heard to be crazy, she cried and said..

I have a cousin who lives in Wuhan. When he heard that the city would be closed at 10 am on the 23rd, the railway station and the airport would be closed. He ran home before then, because he would be going back to work in Guangzhou in the next year. When he returned home, he thought he could take the train from Macheng next door, but Macheng soon closed its roads, and a relative working in Xinjiang asked me to help him get a train ticket for the year after the city was shut down. After the city was shut down, he asked me to buy a train from Xiaogan, and then Xiaogan also closed it, so he asked me to buy one from Zhengzhou, soon came the news that Henan Province had closed all the roads at the provincial border. He finally gave up... it felt like a kind of "metamorphosis" . After becoming a beetle, Gregory still wanted to stand up against the cabinet, then he used his toothless mouth to turn the door key so that he could go out and catch the next bus to the office before he was late.

I had two bites of noodles for lunch, and after a short rest, I got on my electric bike and went to buy milk powder and grain. Halfway down a light rain, I did not take a raincoat, the wind blew very tight, all the way there are no one, met people are wearing a mask. The mother and baby shop where we bought the milk powder had not yet opened. After my wife explained the situation to the shop assistant, she said she could go there to open the door for us this afternoon. When I got there on my scooter, the clerk was just opening the door, and I saw a sign on their glass front door saying, "N95 masks for sale. " I asked her how much they were selling for (there are only about a dozen ordinary disposable masks left in the house) , she said 30 yuan a piece, if you can buy more discount, I hesitated for a while, finally spent 100 yuan to buy four masks. Before going out, I read an article saying that if ordinary people don't go to the hospital, they don't really need to wear N95. They should leave the N95 for people who need it more. (there should be very few places in our county that sell N95.) I think I go out once a week. Four masks should be enough, the masks I bought online should be in stock in a month. Of course, it's also because his N95 is too expensive... the wife's idea is to buy five cans of milk powder this time, because the store has an event, buy five cans and get one free bag of diapers, but according to the store's procedures, to participate in this activity must get a membership card, and in the membership card when the clerk suddenly found that she did not have operating rights, have to wait for her colleagues to operate. It feels like human society is completely programmed, and even if tomorrow is the end of the world, most people today are going through the motions... while waiting for a colleague to come to the store, we had a little chat, and I asked her if she knew anything about the county, she said many people in the county have been infected. The day before yesterday, one of her doctor friends came here to buy 20 masks. The other person told her that his wife had been infected. As she spoke, she unconsciously tightened the mask on the bridge of her nose. I told her that some experts believe that the mask is actually the last line of protection. Frequent hand washing is more useful than wearing a mask. If you don't go to the hospital, ordinary people generally don't need to wear an N95 mask, she said no, it was necessary to wear an N95, the situation in the county was serious, and ironically, she was wearing the same disposable mask as I was, except she was wearing two. The situation in our county is certainly not optimistic, because it is only 100 kilometers away from Wuhan, and there are many people working in Wuhan, and almost all have returned home. A few days ago, I asked a classmate who works in the county hospital. He told me that there was already a confirmed case in the county. The patient had been transferred to Wuhan. Later, I asked him twice if there were any new cases. He hesitated a little, i don't know if I shouldn't tell you... I finally got the colleague, the first thing she did when she got here was to ask how many N95 masks were left, when she heard I was going to buy them, she asked me how many I needed, when she heard that it would only take four, she was relieved, she said not to sell them, someone just asked her for 50. There's no more. I spent $1,500 on a membership card, which cost $200 a can last October. Last month it went up to $280, which is a bit of a stretch. I cycled to the supermarket with five cans of powdered milk and stopped at three pharmacies to buy some face masks, but all said they were sold out.

Once I got into Huanggang, I knew something was wrong. It wasn't too crowded. It was like a weekend, but everyone's cart was so full, everyone was wearing masks. When I went to the corner to sell rice, I found that there were only six bags of rice left. One of the bags was broken and spilled some rice. The noodle shelf was one-third empty, but they're not as big as they used to be. The aunt who weighs the vegetables wears an N95, and when she meets an acquaintance, she lowers her voice and tells her that disposable masks like yours are useless. I asked her if the supermarket could restock the goods tomorrow. She said that today their delivery truck was stopped when it left the county town, saying it was to get a pass. Their chairman of the board of directors went to do it today, but it didn't get done. I don't know if it can be done tomorrow. A bespectacled uncle, sounding like a middle school teacher, said not to worry, the government will surely solve the problem, we have to trust the government. While standing in the checkout line, a young woman at the front said her son's kindergarten teacher was infected, and passed it on to a family of four. (according to the epidemic data released by Huanggang Health and Health Commission today, the number of confirmed and suspected cases in our county are both zero. Ah, there are so many rumors.). Then I saw an uncle behind me carrying the bag of broken rice on his shoulder. He found a rope somewhere to tie the bag... the atmosphere made me buy a lot of things, when I pulled my cart over to the shelf to pick up my groceries, I worried that someone would push my cart to the checkout. I was only going to buy rice, oil, and vegetables for four or five days, but when I came out of the supermarket I had four big bags, after spending more than 500 yuan, I realized it was very difficult to carry them back. I tried to stack them on the pedals, but the cart fell over and spilled everything on the ground. I looked at the Wuchang Fish and Tofu lying in the muddy water, i felt a little helpless, and when I heard people laughing, I thought they were laughing at my greed and fear. I ended up with a bag hanging from one of the handlebars of both cars before I staggered home. Back home, I told my wife about the supermarket, she told me to go back and buy some back, I said I was a bit sick, do not want to go out..

After dinner, my cold symptoms worsened, my head was dizzy, my throat was sore, my nose kept running, but I took my temperature and didn't have a fever, but I heard that the initial symptoms might not be fever. It is impossible to say that I am not afraid. In the past 14 days, I have contacted at least 10 people who have returned from Wuhan. Among them, my cousin's house is only five kilometers away from the seafood market, and no one in the village wears a mask... a friend said he would kill himself if he caught the disease and there was no place to be treated. From what I know of him, he probably Walk the Walk...Talk the Talk, i've had that thought, and I know what it means to be chronically depressed about an accident that doesn't require you to take responsibility for it. But the thing is, after my daughter was born, I wasn't depressed anymore, I wanted to watch my kids grow up, and one night I couldn't sleep, and I realized that I might never want to kill myself again, and in that moment, i feel like I've been given a new lease of life. Parenting is a process of self-destruction, and I was relieved to have less of it, so I rummaged through my medicine cabinet and found my Amoxicillin and children's cold medicine, both of which had not yet expired, after that, I lay down. I slept on the couch in the living room so I wouldn't pass it on to my wife and daughter. I thought of Novalis saying that all illness is mental illness, that is, if I believe I have the common cold, then I have the common cold, and now I have to rely on Idealism to console myself.

January 27,2020

When my wife called me up last night to soak up the formula, I was in a nightmare, as if my wife thought I was so easily moved, I must have caught a cold -- a nightmare, as if I had a bunch of rats in my house, rummaging through the books on the shelves: It might have something to do with the thought of Reading Camus's plague before I went to bed. After getting up in the morning, the cold symptom did not aggravate, also did not reduce, I looked carefully "the COVID-19 pneumonia" initial symptom, I did not have the fever, the Asthenia, the dry cough and so on main performance, should be the common cold, i wasn't sure if it was the flu, because my father had a cold the other day, in the thirties, and I went to the village clinic to get medicine for him, and there were a couple of people there who were running a fever, but they were all wearing masks, as if -- I'll probably pass it on to my wife and daughter. I have to wear a mask at home today. In that case, the mask won't be enough because my nose won't stop running and it will soon get dirty. Two days ago, a friend said to send me a mask, I refused, now a little regret, but even if he sent, now express delivery also can not, I plan to wait until the mask ran out, go to the supermarket to buy a few cloth mask first use.

I filled in yesterday's diary on and off during the day. Because of the too many words, I wrote about one-third of it by hand and then wrote it on the computer. Sister sent a message that Huang Shang supermarket has restocked, Rice is now very sufficient, it seems that the chairman of the supermarket got a pass. After translating for a while in the evening and writing down today's diary, I feel dizzy now, so I'll take another Amoxicillin and go to bed early, hoping to get back to the rhythm of work tomorrow. There is so much information on the Internet that I don't know what to do. I have decided to watch only half an hour of news every day from tomorrow.

I think reflection and recriminations are necessary, but what we need more is something more essential and more basic, something that the post-70s, post-80s and post-90s generation did not dare to ask or even never thought they could ask for. History has proved that we are a generation of doing nothing. I hope our post-00s, post-10s and post-20s will have some ambition, but this ambition needs us to cultivate and influence, as Generation War made us cowards, so we can still make a difference.

January 28,2020. Fourth Day of Lunar New Year

Today, the cold symptoms have been significantly improved, leaving only the nasal congestion, and during the day to do a bit of translation, and so I finished the book to start writing a novel.

In fact, I do not have much to say about the plague, nor am I too surprised, or even surprised by the surprise of others. Isn't this happening all over again? I admire those people who have been chasing "hot news" for more than ten years and remain angry. What people have said online is clearly like writing on water, leaving no trace at all... maybe this is a kind of horrible middle-aged mentality, this is how young men grow old, and step back into the comfort of their homes. I should be wary of this mind set, of declaring everything useless, everything meaningless. "gradually do a bit, always unwilling to rest, not less than a throw invalid" , only in this way, can maintain the balance of mind.

Since the essay, we have received a large number of submissions, writing truthfully about what they saw and heard during the epidemic. It will be a sincere and weighty record, and we will keep it.

Anonymous@owspace. Com
